VA’s disability program is an ‘honor system.’ These veterans are defrauding it.

This story belongs to a four-part series of a year-long investigation series about fraud in Veterans Affairs. I worked with another designer to establish a design system, iterated on wireframes and mockups, pitched new components like the annotated video component and led development on all four stories.
A taste of America’s oldest restaurants

In collaboration with another designer, we worked on mockups to best create a digestible story that allowed readers to opt in to specific restaurants; I built the digital story while the other designer focused on the print section.
A unique photo story pitched by one of the Post's staff photographers, I refactored the template's photo flow component and pitched features to display as many original photographs as possible.

In response to the newsroom's desire to create more mobile-friendly photo edits, I worked on developing a new mobile feature for the Year In Photos package that cropped in on photos as a default yet allowed users to view full-width photos based on user interaction.

Due to the sensitive nature of the story topic, I created an immersive topper that spoke to the subject's experience without relying on photographs, as we didn't have a standout visual for the top. I continued the treatment from the topper to downpage elements like section headers.

A story that focused on a big-picture issue through the lens of one inmate on death row. In order to speak to both of these ideas, I developed a strong, narrative topper and created the design system of this piece.

A particularly vibrant piece that allowed me to play with color, immersive visuals and the glamour of being a beloved figure in the state of Florida.
